title: Chili Colorado

description: Experience the rich and vibrant flavors of traditional Mexican Chili Colorado, a hearty dish that brings warmth and comfort to any table. This slow-cooked delight features tender beef simmered in a luscious red chili sauce, perfect for sharing with family and friends.
ingredients: 6 ancho chili peppers, stemmed and seeded
3 chiles de arbol, stemmed and seeded
2.5 pounds beef chuck roast, cut into bite-sized chunks
Crumbly white cheese, fresh herbs, spicy chili flakes, lime juice for serving
Rice and/or warmed tortillas for serving
instructions: Make the sauce first by dry toasting the dried peppers in a pan for about a minute per side, until the skins blister a bit. Set them into a bowl and cover with hot water for 20 minutes, until they are very soft.
Transfer the peppers to a blender with oregano, cumin, a bit of salt and pepper, and 1 cup of the soaking water. Blend until nice and smooth. Strain the sauce and set aside.

Heat the olive oil in a large pot or Dutch oven over medium-high heat. Toss the cubed chuck roast in the flour with a bit of salt and pepper to coat them. Brown the beef on all sides, about 5 minutes. Remove to a plate and set aside.
Reduce the heat to medium. Add the onion and peppers and cook until softened, about 5 minutes. Add the garlic and cook for 1 minute, stirring occasionally.

Add the red chili sauce and stock to the pot and bring to a boil. Add the browned meat back to the pot. Reduce the heat, cover, and simmer for at least 30 minutes to let the flavors develop. For melt-in-your-mouth tender beef, simmer for 2 hours or more.
If you’d like to thicken the chili, remove the cover and increase the heat. Cook until the moisture cooks out and your preferred thickness is achieved.
tips: For the best flavor, allow the chili to simmer longer. Serve with fresh herbs and a squeeze of lime for an extra flavor boost.

With its deep, rich flavors and tender beef, this dish is perfect for cozy gatherings and family dinners. The vibrant red sauce, made from a blend of dried chilies, adds a beautiful color and a complex taste that will leave everyone wanting more.

Start by toasting the dried peppers to enhance their flavor, then soak them until soft.

note.label: You Must Know
note.content:
• Simmering longer allows the flavors to meld beautifully.
  • Avoid overcrowding the pot when browning the meat for a better sear.
  • Look for a deep, rich color in the sauce as an indicator of flavor.
  • Store leftovers in the fridge for up to 3 days; reheat gently on the stove.

structured_content.content: Sharing Chili Colorado with loved ones is one of my favorite traditions. It’s a dish that not only fills the belly but also warms the heart, making every gathering feel special.

Enhance your Chili Colorado with fresh cilantro, a dash of smoked paprika, or even a splash of beer for a unique twist. Experiment with different chilies to find your perfect balance of heat and flavor.
Pair your Chili Colorado with fluffy rice, warm tortillas, or a fresh salad. A cold beer or a fruity margarita makes for a delightful beverage pairing.
For a lighter version, try using chicken or turkey instead of beef. You can also make it vegetarian by substituting the meat with hearty vegetables like mushrooms or jackfruit.

• For a deeper flavor, marinate the beef in the chili sauce overnight.
  • Use a mix of fresh and dried herbs for maximum flavor impact.
  • Monitor the heat closely to prevent burning the sauce.
  • Garnish with lime wedges for a refreshing touch.
